com.github.seqware.queryengine.backInterfaces
Interface SerializationInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
ApacheSerialization, KryoSerialization, ProtobufSerialization
public interface SerializationInterface

This simply extracts the serialization of bytes[] to atoms and vice versa. The serializationConstant is a value that is stored as the header of each serialization type in order so that they can record information for compatibility and to quickly detect incompatible serialization types

Version:
$Id: $Id
Author:
dyuen

Method Detail

serialize

byte[] serialize(Atom atom)
Given an atom, get back an array of bytes

Parameters:
atom - element to be serialized
Returns:
serialized version of the atom with an integer header

deserialize

<T extends AtomImpl> T deserialize(byte[] bytes,
                                   Class<T> type)
Given an array of bytes, get back an atom

Parameters:
bytes - byte representation of the desired object
type - a Class object.
Returns:
de-serialized object, or null if the serialization type does not match

getSerializationConstant

int getSerializationConstant()
Stored as the first four bytes of serialization so that serialization types can pre-emptively handle their own forward/backward compatibility. 0 has been reserved for ApacheSerialization 10,000-19,999 has been reserved for ProtocolBuffers 20,000-29,999 has been reserved for Kryo

Returns:
a int.
